Module ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2
Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint

Class PaintView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.PaintView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class PaintView extends javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas implements Observer
The PaintView class represents the view of the paint application, extending the Canvas class to display the drawing area. It listens to updates from the PaintModel and redraws the canvas whenever the model changes. Additionally, it handles mouse events (e.g., press, release, move, drag, click) through the PaintController.

This class is an Observer in the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern, allowing it to update the display when the PaintModel is modified. It also serves as the visual component for drawing shapes on the canvas.

  • Field Details

      public static final javafx.scene.paint.Color BACKGROUND_COLOR

  • Constructor Details

    • PaintView

      public PaintView(PaintModel model, PaintController controller, javafx.scene.layout.Pane canvasPane)
      Constructor for initializing the PaintView. This adds the view (Canvas) to the provided pane and sets up the event handlers for mouse interactions.
      Parameters:
      model - The PaintModel to observe and retrieve shapes from.
      controller - The PaintController to handle mouse events.
      canvasPane - The pane where this canvas will be added.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(Observable o, Object arg)
      Updates the view by redrawing the canvas whenever the model changes. This method is called automatically by the Observable pattern when the model is updated. It clears the canvas and redraws all shapes from the model.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - The observable object (PaintModel).
      arg - An additional argument (not used in this implementation).
